newsitem.title: USA: Natl Service sees modest improvement for yr.
newsitem.headline: Natl Service sees modest improvement for yr.

text.p: National Service Industries said Wednesday it expects a "modest earnings improvement" for the year, excluding a gain from a previously announced sale of linen plants and possible restructuring charges.

The company said it expects "much of the gain" from the previously announced sale to be offset by reserves that may be recorded in the fourth quarter, when the reviews and sale are scheduled for completion.
The company said it expects it will buy back about 1 million shares during each of the next four quarters.
The company reported earnings per share for the third quarter ended May 31 of $0.65 compared to $0.58 for the same period a year ago.
